revised_title: Fossil Mammals of Australia: Macropodid Family Dentition and Skeletal Analysis
tldr: This article discusses the mandibular dentition and skeletal parts of the extinct Australian marsupial family Macropodidae, specifically focusing on Palorchestes, Sthenurus, Macropus Titan, and Procoptodon. The author provides restorations of skulls, teeth, and bones, and highlights the transitional nature of these species between saltigrade and gravigrade groups of phytiphagous Marsupialia.
